qas.question: In what year was the Scottish and Welsh devolution rejected?
How many votes did the vote of confidence lose by in 1979?
When was Welsh devolution approved of?
What referendum reached the threshold of 40% support?
Who pushed ahead with setting up a Scottish Assembly?
What party withdrew its support for the SNP?
How much did Callaghan's government win a vote of confidence by?

context: The nationalist parties, in turn, demanded devolution to their respective constituent countries in return for their supporting the government. When referendums for Scottish and Welsh devolution were held in <b2_0>March <a0_0>1979<b2_0/><a0_0/> Welsh devolution was rejected outright while the <b3_0>Scottish<b3_0/> referendum returned a narrow majority in favour without reaching the required threshold of 40% support. When the <b4_0><b5_0>Labour<b5_0/> government<b4_0/> duly refused to push ahead with setting up the proposed Scottish Assembly, the SNP withdrew its support for the government: this finally brought the government down as it triggered a vote of confidence in Callaghan's government that was lost by <a1_0>a <b6_0>single vote<b6_0/><a1_0/> on 28 March 1979, necessitating a general election.
